results.title: The "A" list
results.brief_description: A charming digital animation from Australia’s premier centre for animation and interactive media ‘ RMIT AIM. Anyone who has tried to get into the ‘cool’ group at school will relate to this tale about jumping from the highest diving board.

results.title: Rosemary's baby [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, William Castle and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A glossy, psychological horror thriller based on Ira Levin’s best seller of the power of witchcraft to destroy lives. Rosemary (Mia Farrow) is the unsuspecting wife whose actor husband (John Cassavetes) becomes involved with a witches coven. Rosemary’s pregnancy precipitates sinister happenings and she soon discovers that not even Dr. Sapirstein (Ralph Bellamy), a respected obstetrician is to be trusted. Sidney Blackmer and Ruth Gordon (who won the Best Supporting Actress Oscar for her performance) are the ghastly neighbours with diabolical designs on Rosemary’s infant. “Rosemary’s Baby” plays on fears even more potent and atavistic than “Psycho.” Co-starring Maurice Evans, Angela Dorian and Patsy Kelly.

results.title: Room service
results.creator_credit: William A. Seiter, Pandro S. Berman and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: The Marx Brothers are penniless Broadway producers, living in a hotel, who are planning a new stage show and are waiting for the finance to come through. As their hotel room becomes packed by members of the cast and the hotel bill escalates, the Marx Brothers devise a number of schemes to avoid eviction by the hotel’s management. Also stars Lucille Ball.

results.title: Room for one more
results.creator_credit: Barry Milligan and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Victoria Templeton interviews couples who have adopted or fostered disabled children in infancy or early childhood. Discusses the joys and issues surrounding caring for emotionally, physically or intellectually disabled children and emphasises the importance of family relationships.

results.title: Ronin [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Frankenheimer, Frank Mancuso, FGM Entertainment and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Told proficiently, “Ronin” is an action/thriller about a group of renegade criminals for hire, a gang of international professional thieves and killers, without allegiances to country or cause. Deirdre, a mysterious Irish woman, organises a crack team for one high-risk job - to steal a valuable case of unknown contents. The team consists of an ex-CIA officer, a former European intelligence officer, a skilled driver, a top electronics expert and a weapons specialist. The five don’t know, like or particularly trust one another but must work together to get the job done. Director Frankenheimer, somewhat of an expert in the field of car chase sequences, flexes his knowledge here with spectacular rides through the narrow streets of Paris and Cannes. Pyrotechnics, rolling cars, shootouts and a minor love interest make “Ronin” a fairly standard crime movie with some very impressive stunts. International cast includes: Robert De Niro, Natascha McElhone, Stellan Skarsgard, Jonathon Pryce and Jean Reno. Script is by David Mamet (The Winslow boy, Hannibal, State and Main) working under the pseudonym Richard Weisz.

results.title: Round the twist Series 4 - Volume 7 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Arnie Custo, Ray Boseley, Esben Storm, Helen Watts, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: The Twist family - 13-year-old twins Pete and Linda, their 8-year-old brother Bronson and their single Dad, Tony - move to an old lighthouse on the Australian coast. Here they encounter some unusual characters and strange happenings in a series of weird and comic adventures. Each episode is a self-contained story with a surprise ending, guaranteed to send you “round the twist”. In “Hair Brain” Linda gets an advantage in her campaign for election to the student council after a weird experience with hair products. In “The Princess and the Pete” Pete finds the course of true love doesn’t run smoothly. “Boy Bird” has Bronson discovering a magical singer; while in “The Shadow Player” Linda gets some bad news from her own shadow. “Radio Da Da” sends Linda and Peter time travelling, and Bronson performs good but smelly deeds as “Skunkman”. In “Isle of Dreams” the Twists meet the Princess of Atlantis and have a difficult decision to make. Based on the books by Paul Jennings.

results.title: Round midnight
results.creator_credit: Bertrand Tavernier, Irwin Winkler and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A superbly crafted drama, a moving tribute to the great jazz musicians who lived and performed in Paris in the late 1950’s. Dedicated to the jazz giants, Bud Powell and Lester Young, the film features real-life jazz veteran, the gravel-voiced Dexter Gordon. It dramatises the friendship between an aging jazz saxophonist (Gordon) and a passionate young French admirer who is ready to make personal sacrifices to help his idol. Set to Herbie Hancock’s superb Academy Award-winning score, “Round Midnight” is an elegant, evocative ode to the free-spirited but technically demanding jazz music which blossomed in post-war Paris.

results.title: Roughnecks: the story of oil drillers
results.creator_credit: Guy L. Cote, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The work of an oil-drilling crew. Tells the tale of tough roustabouts who bulldoze a wilderness in a push for liquid wealth. (Awards: Six including Turin; San Francisco)

results.title: Roughnecks: the Pluto campaign
results.creator_credit: Audu Paden, Jay Oliva, Sam Liu, David Hartman, Chris Berkeley and Adelaide Productions
results.brief_description: Using computer animation, “Roughnecks: The Pluto campaign” is five episodes from the American TV series. Based on the novel by Robert Heinlein, this series shares the same source material as the feature film “Starship troopers” (Verhoeven, 1997). On planet Pluto giant bugs are on the loose, threatening the lives of space station workers. A crack team of military crew (that naturally consists of a pair of new and green recruits) is dropped there on a mission to eliminate the bugs, no questions asked. Once there they discover that the task is much harder than envisioned and personal politics and feelings start to interfere with the mission as the danger from the marauding bugs increases. Bearing the aesthetic hallmarks of “Aliens” in its design, “Roughnecks” also mimics the space crew’s banter, tensions and infighting. The animation of the show is impressive but highlights the difficulties that arise for artists attempting to re-create human expressions. Funny and funky, “Roughnecks” is an entertaining series that doesn’t go anywhere new dramatically but has some witty one-liners and a great sense of the absurd. Cast includes Clancy Brown, Elizabeth Daily, David DeLuise, Bill Fagerbakke, Nicholas Guest.
